reference_summary:
Evan Almighty
Comedy, Fantasy, Fun
["When God instructs him to build an ark, Evan's life goes from overnight success to almighty mess!"]
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tom Shadyac'], 'Producers': ['Tom Shadyac', 'Gary Barber', 'Roger Birnbaum', 'Neal H. Moritz', 'Michael Bostick'], 'Starring': ['Steve Carell', 'Morgan Freeman', 'Lauren Graham']}
At first my kids didn't want to see this.  This wasn't their kind of movies.  I didn't have high expectations either.  However, the main actor who played Evan was the star of the show. He did an excellent job of potraying a nutty and off the wall character.
First time I've geniunely laughed in a long time.
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Marchillo'], 'Producers': ['Micah E. Brandt'], 'Starring': ['Richard Riehle', 'Chris Kattan', 'Lee Meriwether'], 'Studio': ['Vision Films']}
Have you ever watched a movie and wished you hadn't?  I regret watching this with my children.  I thought this would be an inspirational movie revolving around dance and although I like the minimal dance performances by "Bloom", the rest of the movie was full of morally messed up characters.
Young teens kissing/ Adults doing nothing to stop bullying/Immoral ending
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Thomas Borch Nielse'], 'Producers': ['Nina Crone'], 'Starring': ['Jane Lynch'], 'Studio': ['Phase 4 Films (USA)', 'LLC']}
"It's fun, funky, and amazing", said my child.  Actually, even the teens watched it and they usually stay away from "kiddies shows".  I found it surprisingly entertaining too and I couldn't help but boogie along with the music.
My kids love it.
{'Audio languages': ['עברית'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tzipi Baider']}
The love and devotion that this family have for each other gives me hope that there is still good in this world.  The birth of the baby girl and the joy that she gave everyone brought me to tears.  I wish this family much happiness.
A beautiful story
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Nina May'], 'Producers': ['Nina May'], 'Starring': ['Joshua Blake', 'Scott Clark', 'Kristine Cornils'], 'Studio': ['Willette Acquisition Corp.', 'DBA Allied Vaughn']}
We enjoyed listening to a bit of mountain/bluegrass music played in the background.  This show has a positive message about faith and humility which our whole family needed a reminder of.  We finished this movie happier than when we started.  Now that's a mark of a good movie.
Inspirational & great to watch with the kids.
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Billie Woodruff'], 'Producers': ['David Hoberman', 'George Tillman Jr.', 'Louise Rosner', 'Otis Best', 'Queen Latifah', 'Robert Teitel', 'Shakim Compere'], 'Starring': ['Queen Latifah', 'Alicia Silverstone', 'Andie MacDowell']}
What was so humorous about this movie?  The numerous talks about having sex with a hot guy, bikini waxing, climaxing and other sexual innuendos?  The dissing of the white hairdresser because she wants to "act black"?  Queen Latifah was the only good thing about this movie.  It's rated PG-13 but it's not appropriate for my family.
Not that funny
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['हिन्दी'], 'Subtitles': ['English (UK)', 'English (UK) [CC]', 'English (US)', 'العربية', 'Dansk', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी [CC]', 'Indonesia', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Zoya Akhtar'], 'Producers': ['Farhan Akhtar', 'Zoya Akhtar', 'Ritesh Sidhwani'], 'Starring': ['Ranveer Singh', 'Alia Bhatt', 'Kalki Koechlin']}
I'm an old lady who isn't familiar with Indian culture or rap music.  However, I'm so impressed by the artistry of Gully Boy's music and his story of proclaiming self-worth and self-identity despite of one's origin.  I finished this movie feeling elated and hopeful about my life.
I didn't expect to like this!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Fernandez'], 'Producers': ['Chris Jung'], 'Starring': ['Nick Alexander', 'Scott West', 'Jeff Kribs'], 'Studio': ['Vision Video']}
This is just what I needed this Easter.  My soul needed this to remember who I am in Christ and that He is my purpose in life.
Thank-you Lord, for this movie.
profile:
User Summary:

- **Preferred Genres:** Comedy, Fantasy
- **Family Orientation:** Highly prioritizes family-friendly films that cater to both adults and children, expressing clear disappointment towards content that strays from these values, particularly if inappropriate themes are present. Recent interactions reveal an intensified scrutiny towards comedic content.
- **Humor Style:** Enjoys offbeat and quirky humor with a strong emphasis on character performances. There is a growing sensitivity to humor relying on sexual innuendos or controversial themes, indicating a desire for purity in comedic storytelling.
- **Emotional Engagement:** Seeks humorous moments that incite genuine laughter and strongly favors uplifting narratives that highlight family bonds. Discontent surfaces with poorly developed storylines or offensive elements.
- **Realistic Expectations:** Approaches new films with moderate expectations for family suitability, enjoying those that are uplifting. Recent experiences reflect an engagement with diverse themes while maintaining a focus on values and appropriateness in comedy.
- **Feedback on Performers:** Values standout lead actors that enhance the viewing experience, critiquing productions lacking strong performances.
- **Review Trends:** Generally rates films highly, particularly those that promote joy and laughter. Recent feedback showcases an appreciation for narratives that inspire hope and reinforce faith, indicating an openness to diverse storytelling as long as it aligns with positive values. The user’s recent interaction underscores a spiritual engagement and personal reflection from their film choices.
